title: Amarillo police hunt for baby boy's shooter
content:
A sleeping baby struck by a bullet early Thursday is being treated for serious injuries as Amarillo police search for the shooter.
According to Amarillo Police Department, the owner of P.D. Smoke Shop, 2714 S.W. 34th Ave., and his family were asleep in the back of the store about 6:20 a.m. when someone fired a gun through a glass door of the building several times.
One of the bullets struck a sleeping baby boy in the upper body. The infant was transported to a local hospital for treatment, according to a news release.
The suspect is described as a white man wearing a light-colored baseball cap, camouflaged jacket and shorts.
The suspect’s vehicle is thought to be a gray, two-door car with a sunroof, spoiler and faded spot on the hood. It appears that the two passenger side wheels do not match, according to police.
Anyone with information is asked to call Amarillo Police Department or Amarillo Crime Stoppers at 806-374-4400. Tips also can be made at www.amapolice.org.
